posts.author: avado
posts.content:
Vague! LOL

Sorc/pal has Charisma synergistically, but aside from that, they really are a specialist build so they require you to have some knowledge about what you want to do with the build.

What do I mean?

Well, a paladin is MELEE based. Sorcs are CASTERS. For every level a sorc ISNT a sorc, they are not as good as a pure sorc! Obvious, but important. Paladins have a nice class feat granting charisma bonus to saves. In order to make a "spellsword" (caster with melee capability), you need 26-32 levels of sorc, imo. I know some have gotten away with less, but it is a preference thing. When you level this sort of character to lv 20, you either gimp the AB by taking more Sorc levls OR you gimp the spell casting early on (when the low level spells are most useful).

Basically, you have to decide, Do you want a caster or melee? From your other post, you say you want Melee! If you are new to the game (assumed, since there isnt much to go on in your post), the BEST melee caster is CLERIC. I had a cleric guide on the old forums, not sure if it was transfered here or not. If you truly want an arcane caster fighter, then maybe a Wizard/fighter is better to start with.

Another reason I mention cleric and the others is, you put in the other post you dont want rdd. The ONLY real reason to make a Paladin Sorc is for RDD10! The idea then would be pal 15/rdd10/sorc15 sort of thing, though more pal would be much better (20/10/10).

When you think on it, let us know. Maybe someone who is less "rusty" than I can throw one up for you! (I could, but i may have forgotten a thing or 2 since I havent built in 2 years).

Maximillian Kane wrote:So you need to make clear what these requirements are and make sure that you can't attain them by tweaking the aforementioned build. Otherwise, we will be just blindly guessing builds, and that is no fun at all.
WHAT? Blindly guessing is what ECB has ALWAYS been about, despite my best efforts to edumicate! We have ALWAYS had people say "Want best melee build," "want best AB build", or my personal favorite, "Want the best build ever"! People think its all in the build! WRONG! It is "WHAT DO I LIKE TO PLAY? WHAT STYLE OF PLAY DO I REALLY ENJOY PLAYING?" When I did my cleric/hospi/heiro build on my old server, I knew EXACTLY how to play it. I even walked a dude through a tutorial IN GAME showing him the most efficient way to use it. Later he told me the character was strong, but he kept dying at places where he shouldnt have! I designed him to solo a server that was based on GROUP EFFORT (meaning, the areas typically required 3 or more to venture to some areas). I spent literally 2 weeks camped in an area that most HATED because of the difficulty, and I dont think my guy got hit one time, solo.

We can give the BEST build in the world (for us), but if the player cant play it, it is meaningless. I have always asked that requests come with some thought from the requesters side. Think a bit, not on how to build the character, but WHAT DO YOU WANT TO ACCOMPLISH! You may want a high AB build, but the answer to your question may mean that you NEED a base ab of 25 (meaning not high, or 3apr), yet, will have an overall consistantly higher AB (dont ask).

posts.author: Atypical
posts.content:
Just chiming in with the Arelith limitations to clear things up, as the build interests me as well.

Specific spell changes on the server are too numerous to type out, so here is a link to the page.

Some specific changes that would affect this build are: no stacking weapon buffs (GMW + Keen + Holy Sword etc) and Darkfire, Flame Weapon, and GMW have been nerfed in damage / duration. All Bigby's spells have a reflex save (except Clenched Fist, which already had a Fort save) so you can't rely on them for no-save damage. Epic Spell focus in different schools provides a custom spell (-ward for Abjuration places a ward on the ground that acts as a Mass Hold Person spell, for instance) and some have been changed to give them other uses (Abjuration feat gives a bonus to dispel checks, Conjuration feat gives you buffed summons, etc) All casters can take Spell Focus feats.

Arelith is a level 30 server. You must take at least three consecutive levels in your base class before multi-classing and a minimum of three levels in any additional classes before returning to your base class or selecting a third class--which means no taking 1 token level in a class at 30 for a skill dump unless you took 3 levels in it earlier. Some prestige classes (RDD, Shifter) have difficult requirements, so very few people will be able to take levels in them. Shadowdancers do not get HIPS, though they get buffs to Shadow Evade and Hide / MS. (link to class changes)

It's also a low-magic server, where you're very lucky if you find a +3 item. And it's a fairly slow-leveling server, so builds must be playable at low levels.
